Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
What you'll do 

In this role, you will bring advanced knowledge of SAP S/4HANA processes and functions, combined with deep expertise in asset management, engineering, and construction, to guide the development of data, information, and analytics requirements for building and infrastructure assets. You will engage across diverse teams and disciplines to capture needs, clarify system boundaries and opportunities, and promote a coordinated systems approach. In addition, the role will plan, manage, and deliver organisational change and communication activities to support successful adoption and integration of improved asset management practices.

About you

We are searching for someone who:

Demonstrated experience in understanding strategic-level data structures and solutions in a complex service delivery organisation.
Demonstrated knowledge of asset management systems (S/4HANA) with the ability to harness efficiencies by enhancing linkages across various information sources.
Proven expertise in strategic asset management supported by knowledge in the financial and engineering domains.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to define and prioritise data, information, and analytics requirements as well as communicate the business impacts of varying data processes and strategies.
High level facilitation and engagement skills, with a proven ability to develop effective working and strategic relationships with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders.
Highly developed skills and experience in analysing asset management datasets and metrics to inform strategic-level decision making.
Demonstrated ability to plan, manage, and deliver organisational change and communication activities in complex project environments.

Why work with us?

Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. This includes

Competitive salaries

12.75% superannuation
17.5% leave loading

Employee wellbeing

36.25 hour full time work week
Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave.

Professional development

Career progression with more than 300 diverse career pathways and career support to take you further!
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion 

At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds.

Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions.
